[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Integration: Transaction logging] If transaction_hashes() is called after a delay, could the timestamps used for rate limiting be stale, causing incorrect limit enforcement? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Integration: Rollover timing attack] Can an attacker coordinate requests at the exact moment of day rollover to exploit race conditions and exceed daily limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Integration: Redis TTL] If seconds_until_next_day() returns a value but the actual day rolls over before Redis TTL is set, can keys persist longer than intended? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Integration: Atomic operations] Are the day calculation and counter increment in Redis performed atomically, or can concurrent requests cause counter corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Integration: Panic propagation] If get_current_time_secs() panics during rate limit check, does this leave the faucet in an inconsistent state with partially updated counters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: Integer overflow] Are all arithmetic operations (subtraction, division, modulo) checked for overflow in release builds, or could --release mode enable overflow exploits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: Panic safety] Does the panic in get_current_time_secs() leave any shared state (like Redis connections) in an inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: unwrap/expect] The .expect() at line 22 provides a custom message but doesn't handle recovery - should this use Result<T, E> instead? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: Const evaluation] Is TAP_EPOCH_SECS guaranteed to be evaluated at compile time, or could runtime issues affect its value? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: Type safety] Could u64 overflow in extreme cases, and should we use u128 or checked arithmetic for time calculations? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: Borrowing] In transaction_hashes(), does the slice borrowing guarantee that transactions can't be modified during iteration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Rust: Memory safety] Is the Vec allocation in transaction_hashes() guaranteed to succeed, or could it cause panic on large allocations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Day rollover exploitation] Can an attacker send max_requests_per_day requests at 23:59:59, wait for day rollover, then immediately send another max_requests_per_day requests at 00:00:00 to get double funding in 1 second? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Clock manipulation] If an attacker compromises the faucet server and sets system clock backwards by days, can they reset rate limits and drain faucet funds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Distributed timing attack] Can an attacker use multiple faucet nodes with slightly different clocks to bypass rate limits by hitting different nodes at day boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Race condition exploitation] Can sending concurrent requests during MemoryRatelimitChecker.clear_if_new_day() exploit race conditions to bypass the cleared state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Redis key prediction] Can an attacker predict future Redis keys by calculating days_since_tap_epoch() for future dates and pre-populate them to cause denial of service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Transaction hash collision] Can an attacker craft multiple transactions with identical committed_hash() values to confuse logging and auditing mechanisms? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Memory exhaustion via hashing] Can an attacker flood the faucet with massive batches of transactions to exhaust memory through transaction_hashes() allocations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Panic-induced DoS] Can an attacker trigger system time errors on the faucet server to cause repeated panics in get_current_time_secs(), creating service downtime? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: Sub-second request flooding] By exploiting the 1-second granularity of as_secs(), can an attacker send multiple requests within the same second that all get the same timestamp? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Attack: DST transition abuse] During daylight saving time transitions, can an attacker exploit the hour that gets repeated or skipped to bypass daily rate limits? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Edge case: Epoch year 2038] Does the u64 type safely handle dates beyond the Unix Y2038 problem that affects 32-bit timestamps? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Edge case: Epoch boundary] What happens if get_current_time_secs() returns exactly TAP_EPOCH_SECS - is day 0 handled correctly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/helpers.rs] [Edge case: Maximum day value] If the faucet runs for decades, can the day number become so large that Redis key operations slow down or fail? (Low)
